1.26.text: "Everybody in this country should learn how to program a computer...

98.00.text: complicated algorithms as people traditionally think about it.

You don't have to be a genius to know how to code.

build a house... all of these things

158.00.text: and none of us know how to read and write code.

169.00.text:
and when people found out they laughed at me 
and you know, all these things and I'm like

181.00.text: Our policy is literally to hire as many talented engineers as we can find.

187.00.text:
The whole limit in the system is that 
there just aren't enough people who are

190.00.text: trained and have these skills today.

193.00.text: To get the very best people we try to make the office

241.00.text:
>>HADI: Created Code.Org
Whether you're trying to make a lot of money 
or whether you just want to change the world,

245.00.text: Computer programming is an incredibly empowering skill to learn.

249.00.text: I think if someone had told me that

252.00.text: software is really about humanity, that it's really about helping people

259.00.text: it would have changed my outlook a lot earlier.

263.00.text: To be able to actually come up with an idea and then see it in your hands and then be able to press a button

268.00.text: and have it be in millions of people hands, I mean, I think we're the first

272.00.text: generation in the world that's really ever had that kind of experience.

276.00.text: Just to think that you can start something in your college dorm room and you can have a set of people

281.00.text: who haven't built a big company before come together and build something that

285.00.text: a billion people use as part of their daily lives...

288.00.text: It's crazy to think about, right? It's really, it's humbling and it's amazing.

291.00.text: The programmers of tomorrow are the wizards of the future.

294.00.text:
You know, you're going look like you have magic powers
compared to everybody else.

298.00.text: It's amazing. It's, it's the closest thing we have to a super power.

303.00.text: Great coders are today's Rock Stars.  That's it!

309.08.text: 1 million of the best jobs in America may go unfilled...

312.04.text: ...because only 1 in 4 schools teach students how to code.

315.28.text: Whether you want to be a doctor or a rockstar,

317.28.text: ask about a coding class at your school
